abstract: The results of so-called stress tests on Thursday indicate that most banks would survive a severe recession and a crash in the markets, paving the way for banks to increase their dividends and buy back shares.
snippet: The results of so-called stress tests on Thursday indicate that most banks would survive a severe recession and a crash in the markets, paving the way for banks to increase their dividends and buy back shares.

headline.main: Banks Pass Fed’s Tests; Critics Say It Was Easy
headline.print_headline: Banks Pass Fed’s Tests; Critics Say It Was Easy

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

byline.original: By Peter Eavis and Ben Protess
